alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 9:47PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Arapahoe, southwestern Washington and north central Lincoln Counties through 1030 PM MDT... At 947 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Cottonwood Valley, or 19 miles north of Limon, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Arapahoe, southwestern Washington and north central Lincoln Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for northeastern and east central Colorado.

area.areaDesc: Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Washington County
